result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WITHIN NINETY (90) DAYS of release, or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

*With credit for FOURTEEN (14) DAYS time served. Huber privileges for child care.  Good time credit to apply. Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HOC screening. DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE CJF FOR BOOKING BY 12:00 PM ON JUNE 15th, 2016.

Prior: 6741 W Keefe Ave Apt #2, Milwaukee, WI 53216-2787

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FOURTEEN (14) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for child care.  Good time credit to apply.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE CJF FOR BOOKING BY 12:00 PM ON JUNE 15th,  2016.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WITHIN NINETY (90) DAYS of release, or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State advised that Defendant has picked up a new charge in Waukesha County.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Report.  Filed, sdg.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is adjourned to 04-11-2016 at 08:30 am.  sdg
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Report.  Filed, sdg.

16RM017284  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-19-2016

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's, Latasha H., Porsha C.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant called her over the noon hour advising that her mode of transportation broke down.  Defense requested a STAYED Bench Warrant.  Court noted that there is CURRENTLY a STAYED WARRANT.  Court CONTINUED the STAYED Warrant from the previous date.  Review hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter was scheduled for 01:30 pm.  It is now 05:00 pm.  Attorney Leija appeared earlier in the day.  Clerk unsuccessfully attempted to contact Counsel.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ISSUED and STAYED a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court vacates stayed  bench.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 45.  Review hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Robert Hampton for Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery. Defense requests another pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Laquesha Vonge Turner
Current: 6741 W Keefe Ave Apt #2, Milwaukee, WI 53216-2787   (Effective: 10-27-2015)
Prior: 6741 W Keefe Ave Pkwy #2, Milwaukee, WI 53216-2787
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's, Porsha C., and Latasha Houston.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Defense moves to dismiss case for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard, defense withdrawals motion to dismiss. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Laquesha Vonge Turner not in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
